content.description:
As well as boulder problems, Lake of the Woods has a couple of small lead/TR climbs established on a large slabby boulder by the highway. The central and best lead route on the boulder climbs a short layback flake up the central east face of the boulder, then makes smeary moves past a bolt. Scramble descent to north.  
  
 The right side of the Highway Boulder is a 10m long 5.6.

Right next to the highway, at the top of the hill and visible when driving up to the Lake. This boulder has a slabby west face and shorter steeper east face. Walk in from the highway shoulder in about 1 minute.
One bolt and a medium cam. Fixed pins stacked in a blasting drillhole, and (presently hangerless) bolts on top.

LotW is a massive boulder field/slide on a beautiful lakeside setting. This is the largest area in the Fraser Valley with thousands of boulders, many of which are house size. At this point there are only 100+ problems, but the potential is huge. This is the future of bouldering in the Valley.  
  
 Getting around is a bit of a problem when first visiting the area. There are no trails as most of the travel is done by boulder hopping, but you'll be moving around quickly once you become familiar with the area.
